title: Potato Gnocchi with Lamb Rag첫
introduction: Potato Gnocchi with Lamb Rag첫 is a delightful dish from the Abruzzo region of central Italy. The rich, savory lamb rag첫 pairs wonderfully with tender potato gnocchi, offering a heartwarming culinary experience that showcases traditional Italian flavors. Typically, this sauce is enjoyed with pasta alla chitarra, but it complements gnocchi beautifully.
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped
1 (28- to 35-ounce) can imported Italian tomatoes with their juice, chopped
1/2 cup freshly grated Pecorino Romano or Parmigiano-Reggiano
instructions: Prepare the gnocchi. Then, in a large skillet, cook the olive oil, onion, bell pepper, and red pepper until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes. Add the garlic and cook 1 minute more.
Stir in the lamb and cook 15 minutes, stirring frequently to break up any lumps, until it is no longer pink. Stir in the tomatoes. Add the tomato paste, bay leaf, and salt.
Bring the sauce to a simmer and reduce the heat to low. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce is thickened, about 1 1/2 hours.

Bring at least 4 quarts of water to a boil. Lower the heat so that the water boils gently. Drop the gnocchi into the water a few pieces at a time. Cook 30 seconds after the gnocchi rise to the surface.

Meanwhile, remove the bay leaf from the sauce. Spoon a thin layer into a large heated serving bowl. Skim the gnocchi from the pot with a slotted spoon, draining the pieces well. Add them to the bowl. Repeat with remaining gnocchi. Top with the remaining sauce and cheese. Serve hot.
